item.title: Is There a Kill Zone in Tech?
item.description: Recently, Noah Smith explored an emerging question in tech. Is there a kill zone where new and innovative upstarts are being throttled by the biggest players? He explains, So, are American tech companies making it difficult for startups? Perhaps, but there are some other reasons to be skeptical. First off, the nature of the venture capital market has changed due to the declining costs of computing. Not too long ago, much of a tech companyâ€™s Series A and B would be dedicated to buying server racks and computing power.
